entry.title: TBD and Yellow Card to Enable Fiat On and Off-Ramp Payments in 16 African Countries via BTC
entry.summary:
TBD and the Africa-focused cryptocurrency exchange platform Yellow Card recently partnered to launch a fiat on and off-ramp that enables payments in some 16 African countries through Bitcoin rails. The objective of this arrangement is to make cross-border payments not only more affordable and accessible, but compliant as well.
Hedging Against Inflation With BTC
TBD, a bitcoin developer-focused entity owned by Jack Dorsey‚Äôs Block, has joined hands with the crypto exchange platform Yellow Card to launch a platform that enables fiat on and off-ramps and payments in 16 African countries. According to a press release, the objective of this new development is to make cross-border payments more affordable and accessible, as well as to create compliant channels for remittances.
As per the Ap‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Regulations Heat: U.S. Congressman To Introduce Bill Firing SEC Chair Gensler
entry.summary:
Crypto enthusiasts may have reason to celebrate as United States Rep. Warren Davidson announced plans to introduce legislation that could potentially lead to the removal of Gary Gensler, the chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission.¬†
Davidson‚Äôs move comes as a response to what he perceives as Gensler‚Äôs overreach in the digital currency space, with the SEC‚Äôs proposed redefinition of an ‚Äúexchange‚Äù drawing widespread criticism.¬†
As tensions mount between regulators and the bitcoin community, the fate of Gensler and the future of crypto regulation hangs in the balance.
Congressman Seeks To Hold SEC Accountable For Rule Changes
Gensler has come under fire for his proposal to redefine the term ‚Äúexchange‚Äù. In a meeting held on April 14, Gensler defended the proposed amendmen‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple CLO Clarifies Why XRP Is Not Used For Liquidity Hub
entry.summary:
Liquidity Hub (LH), Ripple Labs‚Äô new product, has caused a huge uproar within the XRP community. As Bitcoinist reported yesterday, the community was outraged that XRP is not part of the product, while Bitcoin, Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash and Litecoin are used to provide businesses with a seamless way to manage their crypto liquidity needs.
The outcry has prompted Ripple‚Äôs chief legal officer (CLO) to speak out on the issue. In a Twitter thread, Stuart Alderoty clarified that XRP may become part of the product later. He also set the record straight on the distinction between LH and the XRP based product On-Demand Liquidity (ODL).
Ripple Assures ODL Will Continue To Thrive
Alderoty wrote that Liquidity Hub is an institutional enterprise product that is not designed for retail. In addition, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Reverse Engineering the Future: Bitcoin.com Team Members Weigh In on ETHGlobal Tokyo Hackathon
entry.summary:
The ETHGlobal Tokyo hackathon drew to a close on Sunday, as builders from around the world competed for $375,000 in prizes. The event was kicked off with the first-ever ETHGlobal ‚ÄúPragma‚Äù summit, sponsored by Verse, among others. Engineers and representatives from Bitcoin.com also took part in the summit and hackathon, and shared their thoughts on the event and its significance for crypto and economic freedom right now, and in the near future.
A Pragmatic Start: From Summit to Hackathon
The first-ever ‚ÄúPragma‚Äù summit took place on April 13 in Tokyo, Japan, as the kick-off to the wider ETHGlobal Tokyo hackathon, sponsored in part by Verse. Speakers such as Aya Miyaguchi from the Ethereum Foundation and author Balaji Srinivasan spoke at the event. The hackathon ended Sunday and saw part‚Ä¶

entry.title: IMF Says Sub-Saharan Africa Already Feeling Effects of the ‚ÄòBig Funding Squeeze‚Äô
entry.summary:
Countries from the Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) region face a ‚Äúbig funding squeeze‚Äù which is forcing some of them to cut spending on health, education, and infrastructure. According to Abebe Aemro Selassie, people from the region are already ‚Äúfeeling the effects of the funding crisis.‚Äù The IMF says countries from the SSA region should also consider having in place ‚Äúa well-functioning debt-resolution framework.‚Äù
Region Faced With Increased Borrowing Costs and Reduced ‚ÄòAccess to Cheaper Funding‚Äô
According to the International Monetary Fund, the Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) region faces a ‚Äúbig funding squeeze‚Äù which is being spurred by ‚Äúshrinking aid budgets and reduced inflows from partners.‚Äù Without this funding, countries from the region will be forced to cut spending on health, education, and‚Ä¶

Canada‚Äôs Cryptocurrency Investigations Centre
The police service of Calgary, the largest city in the western Canadian province of Alberta and the largest metro area within the three Prairie Provinces region, announced last week that it is creating a ‚ÄúCryptocurrency Investigations Centre.‚Äù The announcement explains:
The Calgary Police Service is entering into a unique partnership with Chainalysis, a global blockchain data platform, to help combat crypto-crime.

entry.title: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce States Proposed Amendments to Definition of ‚ÄòExchange‚Äô Render Innovation ‚ÄòKaput‚Äô
entry.summary: Hester Peirce, a commissioner of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), has issued her opinion on the recent attempts of the institution to change the definition of ‚Äúexchange‚Äù under the Exchange Act Rule. According to Peirce, the institution is now expanding its reach to solve ‚Äúproblems that do not exist,‚Äù stifling innovation in the process. SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Issues Dissenting Opinion U.S. SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce, also known in cryptocurrency circles as ‚Äúcrypto mom,‚Äù has written a letter blasting the recent decision of the Commission to amend the definition of ‚Äúexchange‚Äù under the Exchange Act Rule. Peirce states that instead of bolstering innovation, this decision will render it ‚Äúkaput,‚Äù bringing even more confusion to cryptocurrency circles in the U.S. Pei‚Ä¶

entry.title: NYDFS Implements New Rule To Charge Crypto Firms Over Annual Supervision Fees
entry.summary:
Despite the global crypto market showcasing a bullish trajectory, regulatory scrutiny could become an obstacle for the nascent industry. Earlier today, the New York Finance Watchdog implemented a new rule set to bill licensed crypto firms over supervisory costs.
This bill mainly targets New York crypto firms registered under the BitLicense. This requirement allows a company to conduct virtual currency business activities in New York or with a New York Resident.
Crypto Firms To Be Charged Over Supervisory Costs
According to an announcement, cryptocurrency companies registered under the New York state will start receiving bills over supervision fees. The fees collected from this regulation will allegedly help the regulator add ‚Äútop talent‚Äù and additional resources.¬†
The New York St‚Ä¶

entry.title: ETH Saw Little Investment Inflows Last Week despite Shapella Upgrade
entry.summary: Ether (ETH), the native cryptocurrency of Ethereum, a decentralized blockchain with smart contract functionality, attracted only US$0.3 in digital asset investment product inflow last week despite the Shapella Upgrade last Wednesday. Additionally, there was 'little activity' in altcoins except for Polygon, which saw US$2.1 million of outflows last week. The Shapella Upgrade, which is called the Shangial Upgrade, is a hard fork that enabled ETH stakers on Ethereum to withdraw their staked ETH from the Beacon Chain, which is a blockchain that was launched on Ethereum in December 2020. The upgrade is the latest major upgrade to the Ethereum blockchain since the Merge in September last year. ETH Investment Inflows Lower than Pre-Upgrade According to the latest Digital Asset Fund Fl‚Ä¶

entry.title: Economist and Political Scientist Refute Claims of US Dollar‚Äôs Demise Despite Trend of De-Dollarization News
entry.summary:
This year, there has been a flurry of news reports and opinion editorials discussing an alleged de-dollarization trend amid a wave of disclosures associated with the BRICS bloc. In a recent article, the American political scientist and author Ian Bremmer insisted that claims of the U.S. dollar dying are overblown. In addition to Bremmer‚Äôs comments, economist Paul Krugman also asserted in a recent op-ed that the greenback isn‚Äôt going away anytime soon and called some of the speculators ‚Äú‚ÄòWeimarists,‚Äô people who are always predicting hyperinflation.‚Äù
Political Scientist Ian Bremmer Insists Dollar Death Speculation Is Greatly Exaggerated
The subject of de-dollarization has been a topical discussion in 2023, as several market observers suspect the United States dollar could collapse in the‚Ä¶

entry.title: gm: Anthony Scaramucci Is More Bullish on Bitcoin Than Ever
entry.summary: Anthony Scaramucci of hedge fund SkyBridge Capital got burned by Sam Bankman-Fried: he co-hosted SALT conferences with FTX and sold a 30% stake in SkyBridge to FTX Ventures. And yet "The Mooch" tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott "I'm more bullish now than I have ever been" on crypto as an investment case. He discusses his frustration with SBF, how wrong he thinks politicians like Elizabeth Warren and Gary Gensler are about crypto and how to regulate it, what he sees happening next with adoption, and talks about Trump. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer: The Problem With SEC's Howey Test Isn't Its Age
entry.summary: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal discussed the "Howey Test," which the SEC uses as its yard stick for whether a crypto asset should be regulated as a security, and told Decrypt's Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts the issue with it isn't that it's old (the case is from 1946) but how it's being applied to modern technology. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Decentralized Pictures Plots Its Next Web3 Grant for Filmmakers
entry.summary: Leo Matchett from Web3 film funding platform Decentralized Pictures tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about DCP's just announced iPhone Filmmaking Initiative, which will support aspiring filmmakers who create a short film on their iPhones, and will be determined via DCP's crypto-native on-chain voting system.

entry.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream
entry.summary: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.

entry.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet
entry.summary: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler‚Äîno seed phrase needed.

entry.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West
entry.summary: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFi‚ÄîReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn‚Äôt Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt‚Äôs Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why‚Äîdespite his growing profile‚Äîhe opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Society‚Äôs Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
